bibl.title: Cleopatra's Tongues.
bibl.note: Plutarch's story (Ant. 27) that Cleopatra was a prodigious polyglot is ben trovato, but that does not mean that we need to believe that much in it is true.
bibl.seg: Rachel Feig Vishnia, Rachel Zelnick-Abramovitz & Werner Eck (edd.), Rome, Judaea and its Neighbors. Special Issue in Honor of Hannah M. Cotton = SCI 33 (2014) pp. 275-281.
Plutarch's story (Ant. 27) that Cleopatra was a prodigious polyglot is ben trovato, but that does not mean that we need to believe that much in it is true.
